Author: NerdyMcNerderson

Comment: Yeah, where's the like 4 trillion dollars of investment that'd be needed to actually make the factories that would be needed here? And why wasn't construction material excluded from the tariffs? You know, to BRING the MANUFACTURERS here, he does know that they would need to actually BUILD the factories right?   He's not stupid enough to shoot himself in the foot on his own plan by NOT excluding building materials from tariffs, right?   It's almost like there was no plan, and he just liked the 'concept' of tariffs he's had in his mind for the last 30 years, but never once decided to examine it deeper. Like everything else.

Comment: I feel that with enough time and effort, the right administration could pressure companies to return jobs that were outsourced to the US. It would mean they abide by higher environmental and labor regulations most likely, but I'm sure with the right team, a leader could start the process. I concede that neither party has started this process, but Trump likes to say his Tarrifs will bring jobs back.
